Hi Dim,  In WRC 24, is the default gear mode manual or automatic when the car is stationary? If it’s in automatic mode, it’s possible that the gear won’t shift due to insufficient speed. We recommend using the VKB tool to check the current gear input status for further clarification.

Even when playing Forza Horizon 5, the Simsonn shifter is not recognized as
a separate device. I can only assign gear shifting under the existing Moza
R5 preset and save it. However, after I turn off the Moza R5 base and
relaunch the game, I have to reassign transmission gear shifting buttons
because the configuration doesn’t stay saved for the shifter.

Could you please advise how to make the shifter retain its configuration? I
would like to add that this is a continuation of a previous inquiry. While
I didn’t specifically mention this issue before, I’ve noticed that the
shifter is also not recognized properly in other games. This seems to be
part of a broader compatibility problem.

合并来自工单760  
      主题: Simson H-Shifter USB – Issue with Assetto Corsa EVO Compatibility  
      描述:  
 Dear Simson Support, 
 I am writing regarding a serious issue with my Simson 6 PLUS R USB H-pattern shifter, which I recently purchased. 
 The device works fine in general and is recognized correctly in Windows and most games, including Forza Horizon 5. However, I am experiencing a critical problem in Assetto Corsa EVO (Steam version). Here's a detailed breakdown: 
 
  The shifter is correctly detected in the game settings menu.  
  I can assign all gears (1–6, R), and they respond correctly during input mapping.  
  However, once I enter the track and begin driving, the shifter works for 10–30 seconds and then stops responding entirely.  
  The issue repeats with or without a steering wheel (MOZA R5), and all assists are disabled (clutch assist, auto gearbox, throttle blip, etc.).  
  In Windows, the shifter also stops responding in the Game Controllers control panel (joy.cpl) until I manually open "Properties" and click on "Test" — after that, it starts working again for a short time.  
  The same issue happens whether I use the device directly or through vJoy and Joystick Gremlin.  
  All USB power-saving options are disabled in Windows.  
  I've tested multiple USB ports and cables, including the original one. No difference.  
  The problem occurs in Assetto Corsa EVO. There are no issues in Forza Horizon 5 — the Simsonn shifter works perfectly and all gears shift smoothly without delay or disconnection.
  
 
 This appears to be a problem with the internal firmware of the shifter, or possibly an HID controller compatibility issue with Assetto Corsa’s polling method. 
 Could you please let me know: 
 
  Is a firmware update is available for the Simson 6 PLUS R USB?  
  If Are there known issues with this model and Assetto Corsa EVO?  
  If there is any official utility to flash or reset the HID firmware?  
  Or if are there other suggestions to make the HID signal stable during gameplay?  
 
 Here is what Windows reports for the device: 
 
Device name: [insert exact name from joy.cpl] Hardware ID: [insert what appears in Device Manager → Properties → Details → Hardware IDs] 
 Thank you for your support — I really want to continue using this great device in Assetto Corsa EVO, but right now it’s unusable. 
 Best regards, DMITRI RABINOVICH Location CANADA / Order ID: 8201309133660901

you don't want to answer me anything, you asked me to wait and not return
the device, a month has already passed and there have been no messages from
you

Hi Dim,  Due to our company relocation on July 1st, our testing equipment has not yet been fully commissioned, so we haven’t been able to verify the issue you reported in time. We sincerely apologize for this. However, this issue has already been included in our testing plan. In theory, our shifter outputs consistent data, and other game controllers also capture this signal, so I believe this is more likely an issue with the game itself. Of course, we will work on making it function properly, especially if similar shifters have already achieved this. Please be patient for a bit longer. In the meantime, please take a photo of your current device so we can confirm whether it supports online updates.
